translations.translation: Recite to them the story of Ibrahim
Relate the news of Abraham to them.
And recount to them the story of Abraham:
Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.
And recite to them the news of Ibrahim.
And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.
And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.
And recite to them the tiding of Abraham
Recite unto them the story of Abraham:
Tell them the story of Abraham,
And recite unto them the story of Ibrahim.
Relate to them the account of Abraham
And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.
And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).
And recite to them the news of Abraham.
And relate to them the story of Abraham.
And recite to them the news of Abraham,
[26:69] And recite to them, the disbelievers of Mecca, the tiding, the tale, of Abraham (Ibrāhīma is substituted by [the following, idh qāla, ‘when he said’])
(Recite unto them) unto Quraysh, your people (the story of Abraham) the event of Abraham in the Qur'an:

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَٱتْلُ } يا أكمل الرسل { عَلَيْهِمْ } أي: على مكذبي قريش ومعانديهم { نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ } [الشعراء: 69] أي: قصة جدك الخليل - صلوات الرحمن عليه - مع قومه

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: يقول الحق جل جلاله: { واتلُ عليهم } أي: على المشركين { نبأَ إبراهيمَ } أي: خبره العظيم الشأن، ولم يأمر في قصص هذه السورة بتلاوة قِصَّةٍ إلا في هذه تفخيماً لشأنه، وتعظيماً لأمر التوحيد، الذي دلت عليه
